tweet:
As we close out #WomensHistoryMonth, I want to take a moment to recognize another truly amazing woman, my moms. 

In addition to being a great mother, she was an amazing entrepreneur, establishing a beauty salon in Sumter, South Carolina that still operates today. pic.twitter.com/v5CdMo16gP

This legislation builds on the steps taken by the ACA to further expand community health centers by ensuring the millions of Americans who get primary care from community health centers continue to receive care. https://m.dailykos.com/stories/2019/3/28/1845930/-Bernie-and-Clyburn-Introduce-Bill-to-Access-to-Health-Care-by-Expanding-Community-Health-Centers …

These migrant families are coming to our borders fleeing violence and seeking a better life, but instead of providing them a safe haven this Administration is caging them in parking lots. 

This is immoral and inhumane. We must stop this madness. https://twitter.com/NickMiroff/status/1110958165250764800 …

Every able-bodied American ought to be allowed to serve our country, regardless of how they identify.

This president’s #TransMilitaryBan is unconstitutional and outright discriminatory.

Today, @HouseDemocrats are rejecting this ban, and we urge our colleagues to do the same.

The Community Health Center & Primary Care Workforce Expansion Act of 2019 expands access to health care for millions of Americans who live with barriers to quality health care access such as income, geography, and insurance status. pic.twitter.com/a8h4OdVcqI

Community health centers save the health care system over $24 billion annually & provide high quality, affordable care to millions of Americans.

The Community Health Center & Primary Care Workforce Expansion Act of 2019 ensures that we reinvest & expand these vital facilities. pic.twitter.com/8hgkLQQt77

Watch live as I’m joined by @SenSanders to introduce the Community Health Center and Primary Care Workforce Expansion Act of 2019.
 
This bill will increase funding for community health centers which provide primary health care for millions of Americans. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hcj4_GSVV7I …

What we ought to be doing is finding ways to shore up the Affordable Care Act. 

Instead, this president wants to take us back to the times where insurance companies could deny coverage because of pre-existing conditions and kick you off of a policy once you got sick. pic.twitter.com/kxfzgytaXi

Equal pay for equal work = equal rights. 

Women still earn 80 cents on average for every dollar men earn. 

Employers who discriminate must be held accountable. #EqualPay

Climate change is a fact, not a myth.

By pulling us out of the Paris Climate Agreement, this administration is denying accountability in curbing emissions and cutting pollution.

We must have #ClimateActionNow so future generations aren’t left with the consequences.

735 people die from gun violence every week in America.

Today, representatives from @AMarch4OurLives put the words “Your Complacency Kills Us” on the front lawn of the Capitol.

They’re right.

How many more lives must be lost before we pass common sense gun reform? pic.twitter.com/Pyv536AwCq

We must have 100% broadband deployment in our rural communities.
 
The #SaveTheNet Act helps establish broadband access for rural communities through programs like Lifeline and the Connect America Fund. pic.twitter.com/QPRUJjZ4QO

Hyper-partisan #gerrymandering has gotten out of hand.

The packing and stacking of minority voters are producing districts that don't reflect the diversity of their jurisdictions. This needs to be fully and judiciously addressed.

Today @Scotus has the chance to do that.
Wishing my good friend and our distinguished leader, @SpeakerPelosi, a very Happy Birthday. pic.twitter.com/mXlDUCZXWZ

This administration has moved to completely invalidate the Affordable Care Act.

How are children who are born with diabetes supposed to get insurance coverage now? How are people who have cancer supposed to pay for their treatments? pic.twitter.com/71Xh2Bvc1s
https://www.postandcourier.com/news/at-nd-march-for-our-lives-rally-in-north-charleston/article_1a29b66e-4e81-11e9-8427-37a35db5a274.html …
In the meantime, Congress will continue to fulfill its oath to uphold the constitution by providing oversight of this administration.

We should not construe a four page letter from the Attorney General with the complete findings of Special Counsel Mueller’s investigation. The entire findings of the report must be made public to Congress and the American people before we draw any conclusions. #ReleaseTheReport

The American people have a right to know everything that is in special counsel Robert Mueller's report.

The DOJ must submit the full report to Congress and make it public. #ReleaseTheReport

#WomensHistoryMonth is a good time to talk about one of my personal heroines, Shirley Chisholm, whom I met during the 1972 Democratic Convention. 
 
That was the same year she ran for president, and I, and my mentor, Dr. Roswell N. Beck, cast our votes for her at that convention. pic.twitter.com/ng4Gdo1DWC

Without #NetNeutrality, internet service providers can slow down speeds, charge inflated prices, and block competitors.
 
The #SaveTheNet Act gives control back to the people, not the providers. pic.twitter.com/JUzGFylTld

Today marks the 54th anniversary of the march to Montgomery, Alabama.

People traveled from all across the country to take part in the historic protest in order to fight for the civil rights that ought to be guaranteed to all Americans. pic.twitter.com/YDKQRn75CA
https://www.postandcourier.com/politics/poll-shows-south-carolina-overwhelmingly-supports-closing-charleston-loophole/article_810d626a-4b46-11e9-b336-d77962703e10.html …

As we celebrate #WomensHistoryMonth, I want to recognize Agnes Wilson, my HS French teacher, who was a great influence in my political career.

She was also a history maker herself, becoming the first African American state president of the South Carolina Education Association. pic.twitter.com/wDsJ4zdo4X
Thank you so much for having me. https://twitter.com/jvkap/status/1107748904043343872 …

The legal counsel provided must stop encouraging plea deals just to reduce their workload. 

We must provide enough public defenders to handle the caseloads. 
And we must stop imprisoning people just because they can’t afford the bail.

The 1963 Gideon v. Wainwright @Scotus decision ruled that all defendants have the right to counsel, freeing thousands of people who would have otherwise been imprisoned for crimes they did not commit. 

However, there is still work to be done in our criminal justice system.

St. Patrick’s Day helps us appreciate and honor the great diversity of backgrounds and experiences that help to make us the greatest nation on earth. 

Wishing everyone a safe and happy #StPatricksDay. pic.twitter.com/5etinqUger
Proud to have four members of my staff featured in this talented leadership group. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/15/us/house-staff-minorities-democrats.html …

In the words of Dr. King, “hate cannot drive out hate, only love can do that.”

Today, America stands with our friends in New Zealand as they face the devastating impact of hate, and send heartfelt condolences to the entire country in this dark time.
“Every American citizen must have an equal right to vote.” —President Lyndon B. Johnson https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=11&v=5NvPhiuGZ6I …

Fairness & equality are central to our nation's values, yet members of the #LGBTQ community can still be discriminated against in employment, housing, & other areas.

Civil rights should apply equitably to all Americans. We must end this discrimination and pass the #EqualityAct. pic.twitter.com/5tb74tPO1b

Congratulations @KaiTheSinger1 on your @AmericanIdol audition and for making it through to Hollywood! 

I and the rest of South Carolina will be cheering you on. https://www.postandcourier.com/charleston_scene/year-old-from-south-carolina-gets-american-idol-golden-ticket/article_b54bae18-4030-11e9-8afe-03f142e6a752.html …

Over 500,000 people every year plan their vacations through consulting the National Parks Service.

This means that South Carolina will be well positioned to have new people coming to our state and helping our economy. https://thetandd.com/opinion/editorial/preserving-restoring-our-history/article_bf5e6ea8-6dfe-56eb-9a64-4c2f901fd31d.html …

The #TrumpBudget continues to push tax cuts for the rich & increases the deficit while slashing funds for programs that benefit hard-working Americans most. 

A budget is a statement of our values, & the president’s budget shows that he values corporations over working families. pic.twitter.com/IQXW1kAW1t

Wishing a happy 107th birthday to the Girl Scouts! 

In addition to selling delicious cookies, the @girlscouts prepares girls for a lifetime of leadership.

This president wants $8.6 billion for his ineffective border wall, but wants to cut money from: 
-Education
-Healthcare
-Environmental Protection
-Medicare & Medicaid
#TrumpBudget https://www.politico.com/story/2019/03/09/trump-budget-1214791 …

On this #InternationalWomensDay I wanted to take a moment to highlight one of my personal "sheroes", Dr. Mary Mcleod Bethune. 

I sat down with @RepValDemings to talk about Bethune’s legacy and how she continues to make history even now. #WomensHistoryMonth pic.twitter.com/16oZDtgrsx

We are the most diverse Caucus in the history of Congress. 

Each of us brings our own familial backgrounds and personal experiences to this august body. 

Those experiences help shape our values and our perspectives as we do the work of the American people. pic.twitter.com/gYowwIWplN

We can be no more or any less than what those experiences allow us to be. 

To recognize and honor the experiences of one member of our Caucus does not mean that we ignore or dishonor the experiences of another. pic.twitter.com/YdzGPFoQk6

Today, on the anniversary of #BloodySunday, we recognize the sacrifices made by those attacked while trying to peacefully cross Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Alabama.

And we thank them for their willingness to put their lives on the line in pursuit of equal rights for all. pic.twitter.com/5RxdA0oJe1

I am honored to have not one but two @CapitolHillCBA 2019 Trailblazer’s Awards recipients on my staff! 

Ashli Palmer, my Director of Floor Operations & Wintta Woldemariam, my Policy Director were recognized not only for their success but for blazing trails for others to follow. pic.twitter.com/D7HK0aW091

In the 21st century, access to a free and open internet isn’t a privilege, it’s a right. 

Democrats are working to give power back to the people and #SaveTheNet. pic.twitter.com/UsczaoUmj8

House Democrats have done our job to pass commonsense gun reform.

Now it's time for the Senate to do theirs. https://www.post-gazette.com/opinion/editorials/2019/03/05/Reasonable-gun-bills-commonsense-reform-Second-Amendment-US-Senate/stories/201903050044 …

Last year, 276,000 gun background checks were not completed in the 3-day window, meaning those guns could have gone to prohibited owners. 

Our #CharlestonLoophole bill gives the FBI more time to do its job so we can keep guns from prohibited owners. https://thinkprogress.org/exclusive-as-congress-considers-a-fix-to-gun-loophole-new-fbi-data-shows-the-size-of-the-problem-093354b9c31f/ …

Today marks how long AAPI women must work into this year, on average, to match the annual pay of white men during the previous calendar year. 

People ought to be paid equally for doing equal work, regardless of their gender or ethnicity. 

We must #CloseTheWageGap now! pic.twitter.com/VUiRP2QGpF

Today, 90 percent of background checks are completed within 90 seconds, and 96 percent are completed within three days. 

Our bill would allow law enforcement additional time to review the backgrounds of the other 4 percent. https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2019/03/03/this-small-common-sense-gun-reform-would-save-lives-republicans-should-get-behind-it/?noredirect=on&utm_term=.ae9e743366d9 …
https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2019/03/03/this-small-common-sense-gun-reform-would-save-lives-republicans-should-get-behind-it/?noredirect=on&utm_term=.56ca343b8a26 …
https://www.postandcourier.com/politics/us-house-passes-bill-to-close-charleston-loophole-for-gun/article_82a7d844-3ae8-11e9-9c82-a79568a1347f.html …
https://www.postandcourier.com/opinion/editorials/editorial-expanded-background-checks-an-important-step/article_ce673f26-3b9d-11e9-ace8-7395af4b5bcf.html …
https://thehill.com/homenews/house/432020-house-passes-second-major-gun-bill …
